channel.title: Are we really dead?
channel.description:
When you die, theres 7 seconds in which you are in a dream state. You're unconsciously conscious. However, while dreaming, we lose all perception of time. A day could be a minute, a second could be a year. So what if you've been dead for 3 seconds and all of your life up till now has been a dream... If you could grasp that concept, then you could enter a lucid dream state. A state in which you can control your environment. It would be as though you have entered the matrix.
So, everybody knows there's tons of theories out there. Some of the theories are that life Is just a dream and that we are already dead.
As the paragraph stated above, If you were aware that your life is just a dream, then you could control the the dream.
/discuss your opinions/theories

item.title: Are we really dead?
item.dc:creator: @Enigma1 Enigma_
item.description:
@Enigma1 wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:2, topic:428867”]Where is your proof of this special consciousness pre-mortem? If someone is shot in the head, are they going to have those 7 seconds? If we’re dreaming, why are we still subject to laws of nature, pain, etc. Real dreaming rarely has pain, unless we consciously want it. In the real world, few people actually look for pain. This is completely backward to dreaming.

The theory just sounds like weak solipsism to me, as a means to get “people thinking.”[/quote]

The problem with that is the fact that you’re still thinking conventionally.
Your thought process is still allowing itself to be subjugated by the rules of the reality we’ve apparently created for ourselves.

If we’re indeed in our own reality, the absolute reality may be drastically different.
In-fact, we could be a different species, the world as we know it could be non-existent.
Virtually everything could be a radical obfuscation of the one we’ve forgotten.

Everything from the colour of the sky, if there truly is such a thing, to the hard elements could be a wisp of creativity in our minds.

In theory, we could be in an instanced reality created by our minds in the 7 seconds before death, the life beforehand could even have been the product of another such phenomenon, many times over.

The fact remains, reality is what we make of it.
Simply electrical impulses interpreted by the brain.

In my opinion, there are very few reason to even desire escape from The Matrix.
I mean, honestly the movies are a bit ludicrous.

“Yes! We’ve conquered the machines! The planet with scorched skies is ours! We can finally live in our caves in peace!”

I’d rather live in The Matrix comfortably, than escape.
Although, if I was like Popper I’d definitely want to escape.

Read full topic

item.title: Are we really dead?
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

Hmph, so if all of this is actually a dream then you’re all illusions created by me?
So I’m arguing with my brain? But then of course if this theory isn’t true and you believe in it you probably think I’m an illusion.

Read full topic

item.title: Are we really dead?
item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_
item.description:
@lemme_winks wrote:

[quote=“TheCyberMan, post:115, topic:428867”][quote author=JavaTC link=topic=531564.msg3890036#msg3890036 date=1326760990]
Surprised that this thread is still going. After our brains shut down, we see, feel, and hear nothing, or at least we can’t comprehend it. Our brain controls all of our bodies functions, and after it stops, they also stop. Religion has always been used to answer the unanswerable, and death is basically the final unknown.
[/quote]

Couldn’t have said it better myself. What happens after death is beyond us as humans.[/quote]

we just die. the brain is like a kernel. if the brain doesn’t work, our body won’t do anything–it’s just a bag of organs. unless doctors discover an eternal living soul in our body, this is the belief/pretty-much-a-fact i will stick with. what’s the problem?

Read full topic

item.title: Are we really dead?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:83, topic:428867”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=531564.msg3885057#msg3885057 date=1326379525]
inb4 plato’s allegory of the cave.
[/quote]

I’ve heard of that many years ago. Is that where prisoners are able to see shadows of various objects but not the objects themselves?[/quote]

Yes, aka “The Matrix” in today’s world.

[quote=“Travas, post:95, topic:428867”][quote author=Wet Dreamss link=topic=531564.msg3885954#msg3885954 date=1326429754]

Well I believe it’s highly unlikely that we’re a video game as the world is too large and we have too much knowledge, I’ve never had a “glitch” haha.

Wouldn’t you say Runescape is too large? Considering it just goes black after you reach the limit… Maybe that’s what our world is like from our ‘controllers’ point of view.

In video games you die, and come back to life. In this “dream” of life. you just die. loll
[/quote]
Who knows what happens after death? Maybe a place like Purgatory exists[/quote]

Maybe it does, but the concept of purgatory was man-made. Having not experienced death, how could we explain what happens afterward? It’s a paradox.

Read full topic

item.title: Are we really dead?
item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

It’s saying that when you DIE, there is a 7 second period in which a person dreams, but since time IS NOT constant and has no DEFINANT definition, there a second could be a day, a year could be a century. etc etc.

So what I’ve been saying is that, you died in your “previous” life, and now your in that 7 second dream state, but since time ISN’T constant, your entire life up until now could be part of that dream, and only be a couple seconds into it.

Also, someone said you’d be able to see flying pigs or whatever. Maybe things in this dream are weird but we don’t recognize them as weird because we see them all the time, In the dream within a dream, you see flying pigs etc etc, but to the people in the dream, its usually not weird.

/problem solved haha

Read full topic

or u meaning

item.title: Are we really dead?
item.dc:creator: @CreatorAlex CreatorAlex
item.description:
@CreatorAlex wrote:

[quote=“TheCyberMan, post:105, topic:428867”]I am able to discern dreaming from reality, and I can manipulate my dreams.

Are you saying that there must be some way to manipulate “reality” as it is a dream?
(I believe the brain is capable of doing much more, such as telekinesis.) Or are you saying we cannot achieve more than what we can now in reality?

I don’t think “dream” is the right word to describe our reality. I believe there is something way beyond us (God) that we cannot comprehend, but if you think about it, we don’t really understand our reality as well.[/quote]

I agree with most of that. ^

I think that we are born knowing everything, but we can’t access knowledge without simply understanding it first.

It just seems that we’re capable of much more.
(In a way, it’s like we have something blocking that “much more”. Someone will probably clear that blockage some day.)

Read full topic

item.title: Are we really dead?
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

I am able to discern dreaming from reality, and I can manipulate my dreams.

Are you saying that there must be some way to manipulate “reality” as it is a dream?
(I believe the brain is capable of doing much more, such as telekinesis.) Or are you saying we cannot achieve more than what we can now in reality?

I don’t think “dream” is the right word to describe our reality. I believe there is something way beyond us (God) that we cannot comprehend, but if you think about it, we don’t really understand our reality as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Are we really dead?
item.dc:creator: @chazion chazion
item.description:
@chazion wrote:

You can’t be aware of being unaware(unconscious). Even if we you were dreaming, there’s no way to tell. Do you ever remember falling asleep?

EDIT: If someone were to put you in a human sized grinder what happens next, you wake up in your dream world again?

Read full topic

item.title: Are we really dead?
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

[quote=“vManlyMan, post:99, topic:428867”][quote author=JavaTC link=topic=531564.msg3886558#msg3886558 date=1326493545]
Although you could say we’re already dead and simply in a dream like state, even if we are, we still can’t alter the reality that we live in. We will still continue living in this state as if it we were alive in another world. Even if we’re dead in one life, that’s irrelevant to the reality that you’re in now, because you can’t change it.
[/quote]

/thread

(But I still believe we’re just a video game of some other species’ world. :] )[/quote]
So you’re going to jump off a rock to enter a portal to their deminsion?
I saw that on historychannel too haha.

Read full topic

item.title: Are we really dead?
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

Every family in every town on every continent has one. It’s a cabinet, not particularly odd, not out of place. The paint was peeling on the corners, and the knob was a bit loose. The inside smelled like dust and the paint wasn’t the same as the kitchen walls.
You hid in there once during a game of hide ‘n’ seek.
No one told you it doesn’t open back into your reality. Don’t worry, you can’t tell the difference.
But everybody misses you.

Read full topic
